label: [eventhandler] handle normal exits
info:
## Parent process of event handler

A followup of [eventhandler + supervisor](https://flows.red-erik.org/f/1c559e3b05c03dbd).

What happens here is that the handler process dies, leaving the parent process alone.

## Process tree

code:
-module(kill_event_handler_process).

-behaviour(gen_event).

-export([
    init/1,
    handle_event/2,
    handle_call/2,
    handle_info/2,
    terminate/2,
    code_change/3
]).

-import(ered_nodes, [
    send_msg_to_connected_nodes/2
]).

init(Args) ->
    {ok, #{count => 1}}.

handle_event({<<"a_single_event">>, Msg, #{ '_eventh_pid' := HndlrParentPid} =EventHandlerNodeDef}, #{ count := Count } = State) when Count > 5 ->
    exit(self(), normal),
    {ok, State#{ count => Count + 1 }};

handle_event({<<"a_single_event">>, Msg, EventHandlerNodeDef}, #{ count := Count } = State) ->
    Msg2 = Msg#{ 
        <<"handled">> => <<"a_single_event">>, 
        <<"count">> => Count,
        <<"handler">> => ?MODULE
    },    
    send_msg_to_connected_nodes(EventHandlerNodeDef, Msg2),
    {ok, State#{ count => Count + 1 }};

handle_event(_Event, State) ->
    {ok, State}.

handle_call(_Request, State) ->
    {ok, ok, State}.

handle_info(_Info, State) ->
    {ok, State}.

terminate(Args, _State) ->
    Args.

code_change(_OldVsn, State, _Extra) ->
    {ok, State}.
